creator: buchananc@gmail.com
text:
I have just recently upgraded from apache 2.0.55 to 2.2.3.  I have a website
which requires authentication (.htaccess).  Once the user is authenticated, they
are presented with a directory listing.  

In apache 2.0.55, this worked fine.  However, since the migration, I get this
browser error:
_______________________-
Server error!

The server encountered an internal error and was unable to complete your
request. Either the server is overloaded or there was an error in a CGI script.

If you think this is a server error, please contact the webmaster.

The configurations were the same originally and I didn't see any related issues
on your message boards, so I am lost here.  The server is definitely not
overloaded.  I tried changing some apache directives in the virtual host file
for this website (Options, IndexOptions, etc.) to no avail. I even tried
increasing the LimitInternalRecursion rate and that still did not work.

I think this might be a bug.  Please reply whenever you have some spare time. 
Thanks.

creator: slive@apache.org
text:
You've got an infinite loop on your site.  It's hard to know what could be
creating it without seeing more config details.  I suggest stripping back to the
default config, make sure you can get the directory listing working, and then
slowly add back your other customizations.
